metadata.title: CVE-2023-4585 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 116, Firefox ESR 115.1, andThunderbird 115.1. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 117,Firefox ESR < 115.2, and Thunderbird < 115.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs102: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
